name: ImmutaNorm
short_description:
This project is not a replacement for relational or object databases. It is an implementation of structure and pattern that optimised for distribution and immutable referencing. 

The idea being that if you can absolutely trust the content of a reference not changing from the time it is referenced; you can store that chunk anywhere and build many layers upon it. There is a complexity overhead in representing data in this form. The advantage comes with more layers of reference and many common references.

Secondly having a relatively simple consistent representation of normalised data allows the possibility of programmatic semantic exploration of the data.
